Disclaimer: This post and other posts in the series is mostly targeted towards landing a job at FAANG companies as a new grad / intern software engineer. When I refer to “FAANG” in this context, I’m referring to various other tech / fintech companies as well such as Microsoft, Uber, Lyft, Airbnb, LinkedIn, Bloomberg, Citadel, Two Sigma, Stripe, etc.

As you probably know, technical interviews are somewhat notorious for determining potential hires for lots of the target companies. Often times, they require in-depth knowledge of data structures & algorithms, and how to apply them. Unfortunately, universities often teach about the fundamentals and implementations of basic data structures & algorithms, but seldom teach these students how to apply these concepts to solve problems that are encounterd in interviews.
